item.title: Turbine Case Cooling Air Flow Systems

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated turbine case cooling valve remains closed.

numlitem.para: Increase flight planning fuel by 0.4% for each engine with inoperative Turbine Case Cooling Valve(s).

placard.para: Placard below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ENG ___ TURBINE CASE COOLING – INOP CLOSED". Also Placard near Center Instrument Panel: "ALTN FLAPS ARM SWITCH – LEAVE OFF IN TERMINAL RAMP AREA". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated turbine clearance control (TCC) valve(s). There is one LPTCC valve and one HPTCC valve per engine. The LPTCC valve is mounted in-line with the fan discharge air duct and the HPTCC valve is mounted in-line with LPTCC manifold on the high pressure compressor stator case.

note.para: GE Block III engines and on (mid-1995 and beyond) have replaced the LPTCC valves with constant flow piping.

numlitem.para: Assure TCC valve(s) on affected engine(s) are closed.
Select "73 EPCS" EICAS maintenance page on the CMC.
Check that valves are in closed position, 0 to 10% as indicated on the EPCS page.

note.para: If valves are not closed, dispatch is not allowed. Corrective action is required, per the 71-CMCS MESSAGE INDEX for the existing HPTC/LPTC fault message(s).

numlitem.para: Open following circuit breakers on the P180 DC power distribution panel for the affected engine(s), and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:
Open thrust reverser halves on affected engine(s) (AMM 78-31-00/201).

Disconnect the two electrical connectors from the inoperative TCC valve(s) on the affected engine(s). Cover connectors with metal foil for protection and secure cables with high temperature tape or equivalent.
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE-identifiers and close the circuit breakers previously opened in step B.
